Nesterov Accelerated Gradient¶

class optimizers.NesterovAcceleratedGradient.NesterovAcceleratedGradient(momentum=0.9, learning_rate=0.001)[source]¶

Implements the Nesterov Accelerated Gradient (NAG) optimizer.

NAG is an improvement over standard Momentum. It is ‘smarter’ because it calculates the gradient after a ‘lookahead’ step in the direction of the momentum. This results in more responsive updates and often faster convergence.

The update formulas for this implementation are: 1. v_t = momentum * v_{t-1} - learning_rate * g_t 2. θ_t = θ_{t-1} + momentum * v_t - learning_rate * g_t

lr¶

The learning rate (ε).

Type:

float

momentum¶

The momentum factor (μ) that controls inertia.

Type:

float

velocity¶

The ‘memory’ that stores the velocity for each parameter.

Type:

list

step(params, grads)[source]¶

Performs a single optimization step for all parameters.

Parameters:

  • params (list) – A list of lists containing the model’s parameters. Expected structure: [[weights1, biases1], [weights2, biases2], …]

  • grads (list) – A list of lists containing the gradients for each parameter, with the same structure as params.
